moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3
comment: now the typical approach would be to occupy the center with ...d5, after which we have a Colle System.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4
comment: This exchange clears the diagonal for the Bc1, so is preferable for White.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2
comment: centralizes the queen and also sets up a battery to prevent ...Ba6, exchanging the Bd3.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6
comment: as I expected, my opponent preferred to refrain from occupying the center, having deferred ...d5 for so long. This Hedgehog-like structure is a little passive, but very solid.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1
comment: not yet committing myself to a specific plan, but getting the rook into play on its best file.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1 h6 11. Ne4
comment: this invites exchanges on e4, which would lead to a more sterile equality.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1 h6 11. Ne4 Nbd7 12. Bf4 Qc7 13. Nfd2
comment: the engine's second choice. I spent some time here thinking about the permutations, but this was made easier by the fact the Nf3 has no good other squares.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1 h6 11. Ne4 Nbd7 12. Bf4 Qc7 13. Nfd2 e5 14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. dxe5 dxe5 16. Be3 Be7
comment: the retreat looks a little funny, but the bishop is doing more on the f8-a3 diagonal and the e-pawn does not need its support.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1 h6 11. Ne4 Nbd7 12. Bf4 Qc7 13. Nfd2 e5 14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. dxe5 dxe5 16. Be3 Be7 17. Qg4
comment: with the obvious threat of Bxh6, now that the g-pawn is pinned.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1 h6 11. Ne4 Nbd7 12. Bf4 Qc7 13. Nfd2 e5 14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. dxe5 dxe5 16. Be3 Be7 17. Qg4 Nf6

1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1 h6 11. Ne4 Nbd7 12. Bf4 Qc7 13. Nfd2 e5 14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. dxe5 dxe5 16. Be3 Be7 17. Qg4 Nf6 18. Qg3
comment: maintaining the pin on the g-file and also temporarily pinning the e-pawn.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1 h6 11. Ne4 Nbd7 12. Bf4 Qc7 13. Nfd2 e5 14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. dxe5 dxe5 16. Be3 Be7 17. Qg4 Nf6 18. Qg3 Qc6
comment: more defense by counterattack, although is is a little less solid. The point being that Bxh6 does not work due to the riposte ...Qxg2+, forcing the queen trade.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1 h6 11. Ne4 Nbd7 12. Bf4 Qc7 13. Nfd2 e5 14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. dxe5 dxe5 16. Be3 Be7 17. Qg4 Nf6 18. Qg3 Qc6 19. f3
comment: Playing it safe, after a long think, although f2-f3 is rarely the best move on principle. Blocking the diagonal with

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1 h6 11. Ne4 Nbd7 12. Bf4 Qc7 13. Nfd2 e5 14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. dxe5 dxe5 16. Be3 Be7 17. Qg4 Nf6 18. Qg3 Qc6 19. f3 Bc5 20. Qf2
comment: this is OK but a passive placement of the queen.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1 h6 11. Ne4 Nbd7 12. Bf4 Qc7 13. Nfd2 e5 14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. dxe5 dxe5 16. Be3 Be7 17. Qg4 Nf6 18. Qg3 Qc6 19. f3 Bc5 20. Qf2 Bxe3 21. Rxe3 Rad8 22. Bc2
comment: from this point I was just looking to maintain equality, which I succeed at.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. Bd3 c5 4. c3 Be7 5. Nf3 O-O 6. O-O cxd4 7. exd4 b6 8. Qe2 Bb7 9. Nbd2 d6 10. Re1 h6 11. Ne4 Nbd7 12. Bf4 Qc7 13. Nfd2 e5 14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. dxe5 dxe5 16. Be3 Be7 17. Qg4 Nf6 18. Qg3 Qc6 19. f3 Bc5 20. Qf2 Bxe3 21. Rxe3 Rad8 22. Bc2 Rfe8 23. Rae1 Qc5 24. Ne4
comment: I decided it was easiest to go for th exchanges on e4.
